column4: I have a TON of photos of events in different subfolders of one top folder, and I want to be able to project a slideshow of all of them.  What's a slideshow image viewer that can take images recursively in a directory hierarchy?
fspot is installed by default in ubuntu
I'm in Kubuntu, so maybe it's not default, but I can't even find it in an apt-cache search.
ah, I didn't have the dash.  Thanks
yes, but it's not part of kubuntu.  it's a gnomish app
I'm okay with installing some GTK stuff
there's kde stuff for that also
That doesn't fetch images from subfolders.
check out digikam (installed by default in kubuntu, i think)
Gah...!  DigiKam would be great, but it doesn't randomize them!  By the time one client's event photos are done, the day will be over.
Haha, it has to "import" all 4000 photos before I can do anything.  Man, who knew this'd be so hard?
